categories.name: Phishing Attacks
categories.description: Attempts to trick individuals into revealing sensitive information such as passwords or credit card details, often through fake emails or websites.

categories.name: Ransomware
categories.description: Malicious software that encrypts data and demands payment in exchange for restoring access to the data.

categories.name: Malware and Viruses
categories.description: Harmful software designed to damage, disrupt, or gain unauthorized access to systems and data.

categories.name: Social Engineering
categories.description: Manipulative tactics used to deceive individuals into divulging confidential information or performing actions that compromise security.

categories.name: Public Wi-Fi Vulnerabilities
categories.description: Risks associated with using unsecured public wireless networks, which can expose devices to interception or attacks.

categories.name: Data Breaches and Unauthorized Access
categories.description: Incidents where sensitive data is exposed or accessed without authorization, potentially leading to identity theft or financial loss.

categories.name: Password Theft and Account Hijacking
categories.description: The stealing of login credentials to gain unauthorized access to personal or professional accounts.

categories.name: Spyware and Keyloggers
categories.description: Malicious software that secretly monitors and records user activities, often stealing sensitive information such as passwords.

categories.name: Unsecured IoT Devices
categories.description: Security risks arising from poorly protected Internet of Things devices, which can be exploited by attackers to access networks or data.

categories.name: Fake or Malicious Software Downloads
categories.description: Software that appears legitimate but is actually designed to compromise security, steal data, or harm systems.

categories.name: Zero-Day Exploits
categories.description: Attacks that exploit vulnerabilities in software that are unknown to the vendor and have no available fix.

categories.name: Denial of Service (DoS) or Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) Attacks
categories.description: Attacks that overwhelm systems or networks with excessive traffic, rendering them inaccessible to legitimate users.

categories.name: Identity Theft and Impersonation
categories.description: The unauthorized use of someone's personal information to commit fraud or other malicious activities.

categories.name: Cloud Security Vulnerabilities
categories.description: Risks associated with storing or processing data in the cloud, including unauthorized access, data loss, or breaches.

categories.name: Mobile Device Threats
categories.description: Security risks targeting smartphones and tablets, such as malicious apps, unsecured networks, or theft of data.

categories.name: Physical Theft of Devices
categories.description: The risk of devices being stolen, leading to potential data breaches or unauthorized access to sensitive information.
